text: Just checking - the tools in SparseDiffTools and SparsityDetection pretty much want vector input vector output, right?

elements.text: Just checking - the tools in SparseDiffTools and SparsityDetection pretty much want vector input vector output, right?

text:
I wrote some reshaping wrappers for my dynamics and try to run `jacobian_sparsity` . After some time it returns an empty matrix. `ForwardDiff.jacobian` shows there are indeed nonzero entries when running the reshaping wrappers.

This system has 2130 state variables. Is there something else I should keep an eye out for?

text: the repo notes that you should use the MTK version of the algorithm since this one relies on Cassette which has changed over time.
